title: The neuroscience of imagination - Andrey Vyshedskiy

multiple-choice.question: How does the brain produce an image of something that has never been seen before?

options.label: A
options.text: By creating a completely new image from scratch.

options.label: B
options.text: By taking familiar pieces and assembling them in new ways, like a collage.

options.label: C
options.text: By using a pre-existing image and modifying it slightly.

options.label: D
options.text: By using a combination of senses, such as sight and sound.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Hebbian principle in neuroscience?

options.label: A
options.text: Neurons that fire together wire together.

options.label: B
options.text: Neurons that fire separately wire separately.

options.label: C
options.text: Neurons that fire together stay together.

options.label: D
options.text: Neurons that fire separately stay separate.

multiple-choice.question: According to the Mental Synthesis Theory, what is necessary for the brain to conjure up an image of something that has never been seen before?

options.label: A
options.text: The activation of a single neuronal ensemble.

options.label: B
options.text: The activation of multiple neuronal ensembles at the same time.

options.label: C
options.text: The deactivation of all neuronal ensembles.

options.label: D
options.text: The creation of a new neuronal ensemble.

multiple-choice.question: What part of the brain is thought to be involved in coordinating the activation of multiple neuronal ensembles?

options.label: A
options.text: The posterior cortex.

options.label: B
options.text: The prefrontal cortex.

options.label: C
options.text: The hippocampus.

options.label: D
options.text: The amygdala.

multiple-choice.question: What is mental synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: The process of creating a new neuronal ensemble.

options.label: B
options.text: The process of activating multiple neuronal ensembles at the same time.

options.label: C
options.text: The process of deactivating all neuronal ensembles.

options.label: D
options.text: The process of coordinating the activation of multiple neuronal ensembles.

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem with signals traveling down neural fibers at the same rate?

options.label: A
options.text: They would arrive at the same time.

options.label: B
options.text: They would arrive out of sync.

options.label: C
options.text: They would not arrive at all.

options.label: D
options.text: They would arrive too slowly.

multiple-choice.question: What is myelin, and what is its function?

options.label: A
options.text: Myelin is a fatty substance that slows down electrical signals.

options.label: B
options.text: Myelin is a fatty substance that speeds up electrical signals.

options.label: C
options.text: Myelin is a protein that helps to create new neuronal ensembles.

options.label: D
options.text: Myelin is a neurotransmitter that helps to coordinate the activation of multiple neuronal ensembles.

multiple-choice.question: How does the thickness of myelin affect the conduction velocity of electrical signals?

options.label: A
options.text: Thicker layers of myelin slow down electrical signals.

options.label: B
options.text: Thicker layers of myelin speed up electrical signals.

options.label: C
options.text: The thickness of myelin has no effect on conduction velocity.

options.label: D
options.text: Thicker layers of myelin have a variable effect on conduction velocity.

multiple-choice.question: When does a lot of myelination happen in the brain?

options.label: A
options.text: In adulthood.

options.label: B
options.text: In childhood.

options.label: C
options.text: In old age.

options.label: D
options.text: Throughout life.

multiple-choice.question: What is thought to be the key to uniform conduction time in the brain, and consequently, to our mental synthesis ability?

options.label: A
options.text: The thickness of myelin.

options.label: B
options.text: The length of neural fibers.

options.label: C
options.text: The number of neuronal ensembles.

options.label: D
options.text: The strength of connections between neurons.
